snippet: In a move meant to alleviate growing stress in its financial system, India's central bank on Friday sharply reduced the amount of money banks have to hold in reserve.
abstract: India's central bank sharply reduces the amount of money banks have to hold in reserve, in a move meant to relieve growing stress on the country's financial system; action will free up about 480 billion rupees, or $9.5 billion, for lending.
lead_paragraph: In a move meant to alleviate growing stress in its financial system, India's central bank on Friday sharply reduced the amount of money banks have to hold in reserve.

headline.main: In India, Bank Moves To Stimulate Economy
headline.print_headline: In India, Bank Moves To Stimulate Economy
